instruction: What kinds of spectrum was used to quantitatively detect fatty acid values in wheat flour during storage?
Output: NIR spectroscopy system can be used to quantitatively detect fatty acid values in wheat flour during storage.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to quantitatively detect fatty acid values in wheat flour during storage?
Output: The spectral feature processing method used to quantitatively detect fatty acid values in wheat flour during storage was the standard normal variate (SNV) preprocessing method and the variable combination population analysis (VCPA) algorithm.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the extreme learning machine (ELM) model to quantitatively detect fatty acid values in wheat flour during storage?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the extreme learning machine (ELM) model was the mean of RP (Relative Prediction) in each mode, which was found to be above 0.96.

instruction: How were the different activation functions compared in terms of their impact on the performance of the extreme learning machine (ELM) model in detecting fatty acid values in wheat flour during storage using the portable NIR spectroscopy system?
Output: The different activation functions, Sigmoidal and Sine, were compared in terms of their impact on the performance of the extreme learning machine (ELM) model in detecting fatty acid values in wheat flour during storage using the portable NIR spectroscopy system. The experimental results showed that both activation functions had little effect on the generalization performance of the ELM model.

instruction: Can the portable NIR spectroscopy system combined with appropriate chemometric methods be considered superior to traditional methods for quantitatively detecting fatty acid values in wheat flour during storage?
Output: Yes, the portable NIR spectroscopy system combined with appropriate chemometric methods can be considered superior to traditional methods for quantitatively detecting fatty acid values in wheat flour during storage. The past study demonstrates that the portable NIR spectroscopy system, along with the use of standard normal variate (SNV) correction and variable combination population analysis (VCPA), can optimize the characteristic wavelength variables and accurately predict the fatty acid values in wheat flour. The experimental results showed good prediction accuracy and stability, with a mean RP above 0.96. This indicates that the portable NIR spectroscopy system, when combined with chemometric methods, provides a feasible and effective approach for quantitative determination of fatty acid values in wheat flour during storage.
